intro: Cordula bulleniana, commonly known as the Bulle's cordula, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, showy flowers that typically bloom in spring. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and the plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Cordula bulleniana is considered a species of conservation concern.
